title: Alfred Peacock
text:
Alfred "Alf" Peacock (7 February 1891 – death unknown) was an English professional <a href="rugby%20league">rugby league</a> footballer who played in the 1900s, 1910s and 1920s. He played at representative level for <a href="England%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">England</a> and <a href="Lancashire%20rugby%20league%20team">Lancashire</a>, and at club level for <a href="Runcorn%20RFC">Runcorn RFC</a> and <a href="Warrington%20Wolves">Warrington</a> (<a href="List%20of%20Warrington%20Wolves%20players">Heritage № 237</a>), initially as a <a href="Rugby%20league%20positions%23Forwards">forward</a> (prior to the specialist positions of; ), and then as a specialist , i.e. number 9, during the era of contested <a href="Scrum%20%28rugby%29%23Rugby%20league">scrum</a>s.
Playing career.
International honours.
Alf Peacock won a <a href="Cap%20%28sport%29">cap</a> for <a href="England%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">England</a> while at <a href="Warrington%20Wolves">Warrington</a> in 18-14 victory over <a href="Wales%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">Wales</a> at <a href="Central%20Park%20%28Wigan%29">Central Park</a>, <a href="Wigan">Wigan</a> on Wednesday 30 September 1925, in front of a crowd of 12,000.
Alf Peacock played for "The Whites" in the 38-15 victory over "The Reds" in a trial match for the <a href="1924%20Great%20Britain%20Lions%20tour%20of%20Australia%20and%20New%20Zealand">1924 Great Britain Lions tour of Australia and New Zealand</a> trial match at <a href="Central%20Park%20%28Wigan%29">Central Park</a>, <a href="Wigan">Wigan</a> on Wednesday 20 February 1924, in front of a crowd of 15,000, but ultimately he was not selected for <a href="Great%20Britain%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">Great Britain</a>.
County honours.
Alf Peacock won a <a href="Cap%20%28sport%29">cap</a> for <a href="Lancashire%20rugby%20league%20team">Lancashire</a> while at <a href="Warrington%20Wolves">Warrington</a> in the 6-5 victory over <a href="Cumberland%20rugby%20league%20team">Cumberland</a> at the <a href="Recreation%20Ground%20%28Whitehaven%29">Recreation Ground</a>, <a href="Whitehaven">Whitehaven</a> on Saturday 26 September 1925, in front of a crowd of 6,000.
Championship Final appearances.
Alf Peacock played , and scored a <a href="Try%20%28rugby%29">try</a> in <a href="Warrington%20Wolves">Warrington</a>'s 10-22 defeat by <a href="Wigan%20Warriors">Wigan</a> in the <a href="Rugby%20Football%20League%20Championship">Championship</a> Final during the <a href="1925%E2%80%9326%20Northern%20Rugby%20Football%20League%20season">1925–26 season</a> at <a href="Knowsley%20Road">Knowsley Road</a>, <a href="St%20Helens%2C%20Merseyside">St. Helens</a> on Saturday 8 May 1926, in front of a crowd of 20,000.
Challenge Cup Final appearances.
Alf Peacock played in <a href="Warrington%20Wolves">Warrington</a>'s 3-5 defeat by <a href="Swinton%20Lions">Swinton</a> in the <a href="1927%E2%80%9328%20Challenge%20Cup">1927–28</a> <a href="Challenge%20Cup">Challenge Cup</a> Final during the <a href="1927%E2%80%9328%20Northern%20Rugby%20Football%20League%20season%23Challenge%20Cup">1927–28 season</a> at <a href="Central%20Park%20%28Wigan%29">Central Park</a>, <a href="Wigan">Wigan</a> on Saturday 14 April 1928, in front of a crowd of 33,909.
County Cup Final appearances.
Alf Peacock played in <a href="Warrington%20Wolves">Warrington</a>'s 7-5 victory over <a href="Oldham%20R.L.F.C.">Oldham</a> in the <a href="1921%20Lancashire%20Cup">1921</a> <a href="RFL%20Lancashire%20Cup">Lancashire</a> <a href="Rugby%20league%20county%20cups">County Cup</a> Final during the <a href="1921%E2%80%9322%20Northern%20Rugby%20Football%20Union%20season">1921–22 season</a> at <a href="The%20Cliff%20%28training%20ground%29">The Cliff</a>, <a href="Broughton%2C%20Salford">Broughton, Salford</a> on Saturday 3 December 1921, in front of a crowd of 18,000, and played in the 15-2 victory over <a href="Salford%20Red%20Devils">Salford</a> in the <a href="1929%20Lancashire%20Cup">1929</a> <a href="RFL%20Lancashire%20Cup">Lancashire</a> <a href="Rugby%20league%20county%20cups">County Cup</a> Final during the <a href="1929%E2%80%9330%20Northern%20Rugby%20Football%20League%20season">1929–30 season</a> at <a href="Central%20Park%20%28Wigan%29">Central Park</a>, <a href="Wigan">Wigan</a> on Saturday 23 November 1929, in front of a crowd of 21,012.
Club career.
Following the disbandment of <a href="Runcorn%20RFC">Runcorn RFC</a> in 1918, Alf Peacock joined <a href="Warrington%20Wolves">Warrington</a> for a signing-on fee of <a href="Pound%20sign">£</a>7 10<a href="Shilling%20%28British%20coin%29">s</a> 0<a href="Penny%20%28British%20pre-decimal%20coin%29">d</a> (based on increases in average earnings, this would be approximately £1,482 in 2017), he made his début for <a href="Warrington%20Wolves">Warrington</a> against <a href="Oldham%20R.L.F.C.">Oldham</a> at <a href="Wilderspool%20Stadium">Wilderspool Stadium</a>, <a href="Warrington">Warrington</a> on Saturday 23 August 1919, he was Warrington's first specialist , and wore a <a href="scrum%20cap">scrum cap</a> whilst playing, he played in all of Warrington's 41-matches during the <a href="1926%E2%80%9327%20Northern%20Rugby%20Football%20League%20season%23Challenge%20Cup">1926–27 season</a>, and he played his last match for Warrington on Saturday 23 November 1929.
